name: Gunhill
notes: Aromatic barley malts and an exquisite blend of hops combine to create a wonderful balance of sweet biscuit and subtle fruit flavours, with a hint of chocolate bitterness.

name: May Day
notes: A golden beer with a clean orange peel aroma and a hint of spice. Brewed with East Anglian Pale Ale malt, malted wheat and English hops to produce a well balanced malty beer with a crisp bitterness leading to a satisfying clean finish.

name: R101
notes: Brewed to commemorate the last flight of the R101 airship which crashed in France in 1930. This hoppy blonde coloured beer has a malty dry finish.

name: D&B Porter
notes: Dark and complex; Hints of dandelion and burdock with undertones of plum and damson. A slightly sweet start with a dry finish leaving you wanting more.

name: Hobs Hole
notes: Dark and sweet. Hints of liquorice complemented with subtle flavours of dark berries. Smooth and easy drinking. A classic mild.

name: The Hoard
notes: Colour: golden straw; aroma: toffee, light hop, floral; flavour: hoppy, crisp, dry. Brewed specially to mark the discovery of the 'Staffordshire Hoard'.

name: Adam's Ale
notes: Gold to amber with white head. Sweet, caramalt, toffee notes dominate.

name: AH64 Specale
notes: Brewed with 100% Maris Otter Malt, the Rolls Royce of Malts; the hops are a blend of Target, a solid old fashioned British hop with one of the newer American hops, Mount Hood which has nice floral and herbal qualities.

name: Comrade Bill Bartram's Egalitarian Anti-Imperialist Soviet Stout
notes: A bold and tasty Russian stout with a mouthfilling, airy texture and a lot of enjoyable, peppery, bitter chocolate flavours.

name: Red Ale
notes: A traditional Irish Red Ale, brewed with Amarillo hops for a somewhat fruitier flavour.

name: Taurus Mild
notes: Easy drinking fruity mild.

name: Dark Mild
notes: A creamy mild, with a fruity palate, some roast character and a hoppy finish.

name: Spring Goddess
notes: Brewed & dry hopped with floral and citrus style hops, combined with prime malt, producing a golden, malty, crisp pale ale with a delightful flowery aroma.

name: Barnstormer
notes: Rich in fruit with hints of chocolate, this full-bodied dark ale is a complex but deeply satisfying beer.

name: Summer's Hare
notes: Light, hoppy and well balanced with some malt and fruit.

name: Devon Dumpling
notes: A strong golden beer with a fresh hop character. This ale has a smooth taste with a balanced sweetness throughout. Devonshire through and through!

name: Topsail
notes: Launched in June 2010, Topsail is a well balanced beer, deep amber in colour with a subtle sweetness throughout.

name: Ginger Bear
notes: The flavours from the malt and hops blend with the added bite from the root ginger to produce a superbly quenching blonde ale.

name: Peach Melbear
notes: A refreshing blonde summer ale, the hoppy bitterness balanced by the sweet aroma of peaches and elderflower. A peach of a pint.

name: Shunter
notes: Amber coloured beer with a hoppy sweet aftertaste.

name: Sleeper Heavy
notes: A red-coloured beer with a fruity, sweet taste and a bitter finish.

name: Belhaven 60/- Ale
notes: A dark ale but light in alcohol, delivering a flavour of continual chocolate with a panache of autumnal fruit. An unexpected burst of flavour awaits the palate.

name: Folded Cross
notes: Copper coloured well rounded ale.

name: Wuffa
notes: A golden, pale beer boasting a tremendous creaminess which marries ingeniously with its flowery bitterness.

name: Twyford Tipple
notes: An easy drinking tawny coloured bitter which has a satisfying malty flavour with a citrus hop finish. Named after the adjacent parish of Twyford, we think that this tipple is deliciously satisfying despite its lower alcoholic strength. The citrus hops give a refreshing, thirst quenching finish.

name: Vanilla Stout
notes: This stout is infused with vanilla pods which complement the dark malts to create a smooth drinking, deliciously dark stout.

name: Golden Sheep
notes: A beautifully balanced blonde beer that develops with zesty flavours and finishes with a clean and wickedly moreish finish

name: Honeymoon
notes: A golden beer with honey and ginger flavours.

name: Maritime
notes: A robust premium bitter with rich caramel flavours created by an infusion of fine Fuggles hops.

name: Old Habit
notes: This smooth beer provides a strong, dark, sensuous experience with its rich roast flavours.

name: Easter Special
notes: A complex bitter with a dark reddish appearance. Its well hopped multiple malt ingredients give it a smooth strong refined flavour, complemented by the well water from which it is brewed.

name: Middle
notes: A traditional bitter with hint of sweetness which was common in Cornish beers of yesteryear.

name: 99 Red Baboons
notes: An unusual combination of fruity hoppiness with a dark, malty side. This beer is distinctly difficult to categorise - is it sort of a porter or maybe a mild? You decide!

name: Ape Ale
notes: A pale, strong ale. A complex and sophisticated IPA, using assertive American hops. Aromas of resinous pine, orange and just the right level of citrussiness. A dry finish and moderate bitterness make this deceptively quaffable for its 5.4%, so take care!

name: Festival 9X
notes: Deep burnished copper in colour. A serious and complex malty bitter.

name: Norwegian Blue
notes: Maris Otter malts with premium American Mount Hood hops. English Fuggles and Goldings hops provide the balancing bitterness in this malty complex best bitter.

name: Baltic Twitch
notes: A blend of Baltic Stout & Twitchell, brewed specially for the festival. Dark, with a hint of citrus.

name: Bravo
notes: Golden Single Hop beer using Bravo hops from the USA. A light citrus aroma with hints of orange, peach and some earthy/spicy notes.

name: Charter Flight
notes: Copper coloured bitter brewed with crystal rye malt, and a shedload of Amarillo and Warrior hops.

name: Chocolate Cherry City Whittle
notes: Pale beer with cherries & chocolate essence - but no city or whittlings.

name: Porter (cask aged)
notes: A dark, full flavoured beer with hints of liquorice, yet still drinkable for its strength. Cellar aged 9 months for a bit more rounded, slightly drier and richer taste.

name: Bridge Bitter
notes: A bitter beer with a lingering aftertaste.

name: Top Dog Stout
notes: Malty with full-bodied rounded bitterness.

name: Nessie's Monster Mash
notes: A predominantly malty, lightly hopped beer giving a satisfying fullness of flavour with a warm finish.

name: White Lady
notes: Wheat beer with orange and coriander notes

name: Avalanche
notes: Crisp and refreshing summery bitter. Dry hopped to give extra hop flavours.

name: Old Scarlett
notes: A dark bitter with a fresh fruity taste.

name: Roman Gold
notes: A refreshing summer bitter, well hopped, with a light nutty aftertaste.

name: Time and Tide
notes: A mid amber coloured ale brewed with a dark wheat and rye malts. Zesty fresh hop flavours from the English Goldings hops.

name: Tolly Roger
notes: A warming golden yellow coloured ale, brewed using no coloured malt just pale ale malt. Intensely fragrant aroma of citrus fruit and floral notes, this beer has complex flavours of malt, sweetness, bitter oranges, and honey suckle. A succession of waves of flavour burst upon the sense, eager to be enjoyed.

name: Black Gold
notes: A recipe recreated from restored brewing records from the 1800s. The use of traditional roasted and coloured malts gives a unique and luscious flavour.

name: Golden Pippin
notes: A light refreshing blonde ale brewed using a specially selected hop to create a citrus fruit flavour. This golden coloured favourite is equally appealing to real ale and lager drinkers alike.

name: Amarillo
notes: A strong golden ale with a spicy aroma, juicy malt mouthfeel and an extremely long and bitter hop finish.

name: Sterling
notes: A golden amber ale brewed using Sterling hops.

name: Ay Up
notes: An eminently drinkable pale session ale. Subtle malt and floral notes are matched splendidly with citrus hop, rounded off with a slightly dry finish.

name: Gold
notes: A modern IPA with powerful hoppy bitterness and aroma balanced with strong malt notes. English First Gold hops give peppery, plum like and orange zesty flavours. A satisfying and memorable golden ale.

name: Maibock
notes: A very traditional German style Helles bier. Golden, dry, with the slightest hint of maltiness. Typical of these golden Rhineland beers, the Hallertauer and Spalt hops give a pepperyness with a muted bitterness.

name: Summer Meltdown
notes: Well-balanced, golden bitter with the warm flavour of Chinese stem ginger and other spices. The perfect thirst quencher for a summer's evening.

name: Aviator
notes: Unquestionably the brewery's best seller, this amber-coloured ale with strong hints of citrus and a hoppy full flavour develops into an enjoyable bitter finish.

name: Rambrau
notes: Lager drinkers beware! This cask lager is brewed with lager malts and Hallertau hops to create a clean and crisp, refreshing lager-style beer.

name: Albert Ale
notes: Slightly darker than light with a softer Fuggles hop character and a hint of sweet. Brewed using pale malt, crystal malt, and black malt, and only Fuggles hops.

name: Brandeston Gold
notes: Uses barley grown for the brewery at Brandeston.

name: Attila the Hen
notes: The beer is very pale, brewed using Pale Ale malt only. The hops used are English Fuggles, Progress and Goldings, and an American hop, Willamette. Brewed in memory of Brenda Law, a stalwart volunteer at this festival.

name: Black Dog
notes: A traditional dark mild. The beer is well balanced with a full roast flavour. The use of Crystal malt and roast barley give a deep underlying characteristic flavour, which is balanced with Fuggles hops as the sole variety.

name: Cambridge Bitter
notes: A mid brown bitter with a good balance of malt and hop character giving a pleasing session drink.

name: Feelgood Fresh
notes: A pale golden summer ale with fresh peppery hop aroma and satisfying malt finish.

name: Greyhound
notes: A strong bitter with a rich brown colour. The full flavour is derived from the recipe of Pale Ale malt, torrified wheat, invert sugar and roast barley. The hop blend is from finest English Fuggles and Challenger. The rich raisin character is a result of the fermentation of the dark sugars from the invert sugar and roast barley. A palate fullness is another characteristic of this beer.

name: Lost & Found
notes: Copper coloured refreshing bitter. A full bodied beer, brewed using a blend of Rye Crystal and Crystal Malt for a tawny hue. Bramling Cross hops give a fruity hop character. All profits from this beer will go to Cambridgeshire Search & Rescue.

name: Pageant
notes: First brewed to mark the Fens Pageant in 1994, the recipe was used in 1995 to mark the bicentenary of the North Brink Brewery. Brewed with well-roasted malts and generous amounts of English hops, for a satisfying finish. The use of wheat malt as well as Finest Pale Maris Otter malt results in a rich full malty flavour. Challenger hops give good depth to the bitter finish of the beer.

name: First Light
notes: A light Yorkshire ale with delicate hop flavours balanced by underlying malt sweetness. An excellent example of a Pennine Light Mild.

name: Nettlethrasher
notes: Copper coloured traditional strong ale, brewed using six different malts and robust flavours from the combined use of English hop varieties

name: Burston's Cuckoo
notes: A glorious nasal feast of floral hops with a tantalising hint of citrus, rounding off into a refreshingly long dry finish.

name: Nightlight Mild
notes: An old style mild, strong but carefully hopped to allow the malts to flourish. Liquorice hints balance the lasting nutty finish.

name: Farmer's IPA
notes: Light and hoppy, this style is an old favourite.

name: Marmalade Cat
notes: The colour of burnished copper, with a markedly bitter finish from the generous use of Goldings and Progress hops. Flavoursome English pale malt is blended with speciality Belgian malt to add balance and a smooth finish, which lasts and lasts. Full-bodied, yet with an ease of drinking which belies its strength.

name: Meow Mild
notes: Chestnut coloured mild. Roasted flavours throughout, backed up by fruit and coffee flavours. The hops in the aroma appear again in the aftertaste.

name: Stout Cat
notes: An attractively-coloured deep, dark beer. The characteristic sweet, rich flavour of roast malt and molasses is well balanced with the pronounced hop flavour and aroma of classic English Pilgrim hops.

name: Burton Snatch
notes: A sensational blonde with a wonderfully tight creamy head. Vibrant refreshing mouth feel and fresh flavour. The citrus aroma with a little honey is striking and clean. A hint of wet leather adds to the finish of this cracking pale ale.

name: Clever Fellow
notes: A deliciously smooth, rich, malty taste, bursting with character and aroma. Malt loaf and toffee flavours combine with bitterness on the back of the tongue to give a beautiful balanced sweetness by biscuity malt.

name: Gloster Squirt
notes: A pre-war style ruby mild, hopped three times with Fuggles. To commemorate the Gloster Pioneer 'Squirt' which was the first British jet powered aircraft. On the second of two test runs the plane "hopped" three times, each hop being about 300-900 feet at an altitude of around 6 feet.

name: Flack Catcher
notes: A clean distinctive rich golden ale with initial sweetness smoothly spiced with a crisp bitter finish leading to an old fashioned zesty linger. Brewed in the traditional manner using the double drop brewing method.

name: Flack's Double Drop
notes: A classic amber bitter with the full flavour of Maris Otter barley and the bitter citrus after tones of Sovereign hops. Flack's Double Drop is named after the almost lost brewing method of double drop brewing. It is a very quaffable ale that is well balanced, using locally sourced malt, produced at a very drinkable strength.

name: Jarl
notes: A full-on citrus experience. Light and golden, a perfect ale for whiling away the hours on a sunny day.

name: Sublime Stout
notes: Dark stout. Cherries and chocolate on the nose are followed by a rich, dry, coffee flavour. The finish is roasted with cocoa hints.

name: Celtica
notes: A refreshing contemporary cask conditioned golden ale full of citrus taste and aroma. This ale is brewed using a single pale ale malt giving at a lovely golden colour. Citrus flavoured hops are used during the boil to produce an intense fruity flavour which is often enjoyed as a more flavorsome alternative to lager.

name: Welsh Black
notes: Rich, dark and full of malt flavours, this black bitter owes its characteristics to the large amount of chocolate malt giving it a velvety smooth rich coffee finish. No aroma hops are added to this beer, instead seven types of grain are used to develop the flavour.

name: Baltic Trader
notes: A rich and fruity export stout with plenty of hop character.

name: Excelsior
notes: Our exciting new beer Excelsior is brewed to be thirst quenching with fruity hop character, balanced malt and superb aroma. The beer celebrates Lowestoft built (1921) sailing smack Excelsior and aims to help in raising funds and awareness for the Excelsior Trust to keep her sailing.

name: Orange Wheat
notes: A light wheat beer with grainy citrus & marmalade flavours. Now brewed with Citra Hops!

name: 16 String Jack
notes: A golden brown coloured, highly hopped IPA, gently bitter, a little malty and very refreshing.

name: GFL
notes: A pale lager style beer with an initial fullness complemented by a fruit character, derived from East Kent Goldings and Continental Styrian hops, finishing with bitterness and citrus notes. Gluten free.

name: Maiden Stakes
notes: A pale golden bitter with exquisite fruity hop character giving way to a moderate bitter finish

name: Cooper's Ale
notes: Based off a recipe from 1913, this beer was originally brewed to recreate a blend of stout and porter in a single beer. Brewed in Harvey's new 5 barrel pilot brewery.

name: Sussex Best Bitter
notes: A superbly balanced session bitter with a prominent hop character.

name: Born to Be Mild
notes: Smooth, velvety mild. Full strength and full of flavour.

name: Schiehallion
notes: A crisp cask-conditioned lager with a beautifully fresh taste of grapefruit. Delicately crafted using Hersbrücker lager hops, it is fermented at a very low temperature with lager yeast.

name: Porta Porter
notes: Traditional porter made with chocolate and black malt.

name: Wobbly Undercarriage
notes: Dark bitter.

name: Aniseed Porter
notes: A dark ruby beer with an aroma of malt, grain, fruit and background aniseed. The taste is roasted grain dark chocolate, liquorice and aniseed.

name: Baltic Porter
notes: This beer tastes of rich malt, dark fruits and bitter chocolate with a hint of smoke in the background. This beer is conditioned for 2 months before release to allow flavour development!

name: Bohemia
notes: It is made in the style of a Bohemian Lager using Saaz hops, Pilsner malt, two speciality malts (Caravienne and Munich) and a lager yeast from the Weihenstephan area of Munich. It is gold in colour with an aroma of hops and background malt. The taste is initially rich malt giving way to a dry bitterness typical of this style of lager. The beer is conditioned for 4 weeks at 3°C and then casked and stored for a further 4 weeks at 10°C before release!

name: Resination
notes: The aroma and flavour are loaded with hop oils and resins giving intense spice, herbal and citrus notes. This beer is conditioned for at least two months before release to allow flavour development.

name: Golden Gorse
notes: Very light in colour and with a balanced hoppy finish. It's a lovely refreshing drink; the perfect substitute for a pint of lager.

name: Nord Atlantic
notes: Nord Atlantic is a dark session bitter with a large crystal malt addition offset by a strong hopping with Target and Challenger hops.

name: Vinyl Pleasures
notes: A pale straw coloured beer with Maris Otter and Crystal malt. Twice hopped to give a large hop character with malt and citrus flavours.

name: Black Cherry Mild
notes: Our Black Cherry Mild is stirring emotions amongst those who enjoy a full and flavoursome dark mild. Subtle additions of real black cherries in Muscovado with light Amarillo hopping provide a truly rich and wonderful taste experience.

name: Sir Frank Whittle
notes: Made using the finest floor roasted Maris otter malt, it has notes of toffee apple. There's a lingering citrus bitterness from Amarillo hop additions.

name: Imperial Russian Stout
notes: A solid black stout. Sweet chocolate flavours with an almost tar like thickness. A surprisingly clean finish.

name: Josephine Butler
notes: Golden coloured beer, this pale beer has hints of lemon and elderflower in the taste with a good hoppy finish.

name: Abingdon Bridge
notes: Session beer with malty and fruity flavours and a hoppy aftertaste.

name: Loose Cannon Pale
notes: Light in colour, smooth almost sweet, delicate and slightly spicy.

name: Half Punter
notes: Fruity copper coloured beer with a hoppy aroma and flavour.

name: Hedgerow Hop
notes: A light amber beer with a kick of bitterness. Wild hops from around Swavesey provide a hoppy nose.

name: Lickety Split
notes: Dark brown ale with a full on bitterness.

name: Blackberry Porter
notes: A full-bodied, black porter, with a balanced hop aroma and rich blend of chocolate and roast flavours, giving way to a subtle, sweet fruit finish.

name: Maybee
notes: A pale coloured bitter brewed with Maris Otter malt and Styrian Goldings hops. A bitter beer with added honey to produce a sweet finish.

name: Captain Bob
notes: A traditional deep amber coloured bitter brewed with the distinctive Nelson Sauvin hop from New Zealand. The aroma is fruity and hoppy on the palate; there is a slightly sweet maltiness that balances an easy going bitterness that is followed by hints of gooseberry, elderflower and grape in the finish.

name: English Oak
notes: A glowing amber ale with full malt flavours balanced by a strong hop finish from First Gold and Bramling Cross hops.

name: Model T
notes: Full bodied, slightly sweet, with biscuit and coffee malt character and a delicate hop aroma.

name: Mermaid
notes: Colour: Amber/burnt orange. One for the hopheads with rich hop character on the nose, plenty of citrus fruit on the palate and a lasting bitter and hoppy finish.

name: The Usual
notes: Copper in colour with full bodied mouth feel, The Usual is smooth & complex with a malty base & full bitterness.

name: Tess of the Compasses
notes: A dark-ruby-red mild with hints of elderflower and vanilla and a dry finish.

name: The Good Ship Arbella
notes: A pale, hoppy American style beer brewed using American hop varieties and named after the Good Ship Arbella, which was the flag ship of an 18-vessel fleet that set sail from Great Yarmouth carrying puritan John Winthrop to Salem, Massachusetts, in the 1630s. He was born in Edwardstone and was lord of the manor of Groton, and later became the first governor of the State of Massachusetts. Interestingly, the vessel had 10,000 gallons of beer on board.

name: Dionysus
notes: Straw coloured bitter, powerfully hoppy, with a fine citrus finish.

name: Nero
notes: A satisfying, full-flavoured black brew with a good balance of malt, roast and fruit. Bittersweet flavours carry through to a dry finish.

name: Orpheus
notes: Full flavoured mild ale with rich chocolate and malt notes, hints of vanilla.

name: Pegasus
notes: Fruit and some hops on the nose lead through into a fine balance of malt, fruit and hops on a bittersweet base. Malt is also present in the long, dry finish of this brown/red beer.

name: Proteus
notes: Powerful full-flavoured pale ale. Packed with fruit and hop flavours.

name: Sparta
notes: Refreshing pale bitter. Packed with hop flavours and crisp bitterness.

name: Cherry Brown
notes: Traditional English Brown ale flavored with black cherries.

name: Chocolate Orange Stout
notes: A full bodied, rounded soft stout. Loaded with chocolate and coffee flavours with a good hop balance that has a hint of orange on the nose.

name: Grail Cup Moon
notes: Light amber coloured beer. Full bodied, juicy malt flavored with a heavy helping of hops added throughout the brewing process for that extra bite at the finish.

name: Red Watch Blueberry Ale
notes: A true festival favourite making its sixth appearance in a row at the Cambridge Beer Festival. Red coloured beer brewed with fresh blueberries. A thirst-quenching, fruity, refreshing summer ale.

name: Reel Ale
notes: Straw coloured beer. Medium bodied, with malt and hops in the aroma. The taste is refreshingly clean with vibrant generous hop finish.

name: Shelford Crier
notes: A thirst quenching light bodied amber beer, with a citrus fruit bouquet and taste that continues through to a pleasantly clean and dry finish.

name: Essex Border
notes: A golden beer, drinking more like a best bitter than its strength suggests. The fruity and spicy overtones are noticeable from the start on the nose and palate, whilst at the end the the sweet, soft orange notes return, resulting in a complete, well-rounded finish.

name: Black Funnel Mild
notes: A wonderful strong mild using five different malts with roast malt for character. Brewed for CAMRA Milds in May

name: White Squall
notes: Five time Gold medal winning ale, pale and blonde in colour with a full hoppy taste and wonderful fruity finish.

name: Guilsborough Guzzlers
notes: A very easy-drinking malty auburn ale with a gentle hop finish.

name: T'owd Navigation
notes: Dark strong ale from years gone by! Rich malt and hops and wonderfully warming. Not for the faint hearted.

name: Golden Spire
notes: A hoppy, fruity and citrusy golden ale.

name: Jiggle Juice
notes: A festival strength IPA with tropical and fruity flavours.

name: Dreadnought
notes: Rich ruby coloured premium bitter with a well rounded fullness of malt and deep strength of hop bitterness.

name: Rock Bitter
notes: First brewed by Nottingham Brewery in the 1800's as a refreshing quaffing ale for the thirsty factory workers in the city. Slightly paler than traditional bitter beers of the time it was the forerunner of the India Pale Ale for which the brewery was to become famous and transported thousands and thousands of gallons to the troops of the British Empire all around the globe.

name: Goldblade
notes: Full-flavoured, traditional wheat beer.

name: Stormstay
notes: Colour: Amber to copper colour. Good head retention. Aroma: Toffee and floral hop. Hints of tangerine. Palate: Malt toffee and biscuit flavour nestle with the complex combination of three aroma hops while the citrusy Amarillo cuts though the alcohol sweetness. Finish: Dry and mellow.

name: Attila
notes: Fruit notes and elder flower on aroma. Taste of ripe red berries and citrus fruit, with a long, bitter, fruity finish.

name: Citra
notes: A light refreshing beer with pungent grapefruit, lychee and gooseberry aromas leading to a dry, bitter finish.

name: Scarlet Macaw
notes: Tart gooseberry and soft peach on the nose, gooseberries and fruit to taste, before an intense bitterness that’s as sharp as a macaw's screech!

name: Blonde Bombshell
notes: A golden bitter with a good body allied to a clean and refreshing character. First Gold hops and East Anglian malt combine to give a smooth, well-balanced flavour.

name: Gunner's Daughter
notes: A well-balanced strong ale with a complexity of hop, fruit, sweetness and bitterness in the flavour, and a lingering hoppy, bitter aftertaste.

name: Regal Blonde
notes: A cask conditioned lager brewed with Czech and German hops, soft citrus flavours. A lager with taste. SIBA Gold Award.

name: Sunnydaze
notes: A Wheat beer brewed with 40% wheat giving a refreshing and hoppy taste, fined bright.

name: Black Panther
notes: A dark mysterious full flavoured ale with bite.

name: Golden Panther
notes: Light refreshing with a citrus finish.

name: Pink Panther
notes: A refreshingly fruity ale with bite.

name: Full Whack
notes: A strong pale ale in which the high level of alcohol is complemented by increased bitterness and the fruity hop finish is derived from a combination of Fuggles and First Gold hops.

name: Red Rocks
notes: A strong, ruby ale in which the red colour and rich malt flavours come from the use of caramelised rye, which are balanced with the fruity overtones from Bramling Cross hops.

name: Shoreditch Stout
notes: A dark beer made with a high percentage of chocolate malt to produce a medium dry stout with flavours of chocolate and currant.

name: Inncognito
notes: A ported stout with a slightly tarry aroma and rich flavour with a touch of liquorice and dark fruit.

name: Inntrigue
notes: Ruby, hints of chocolate and summer berries, balanced and rounded.

name: Ambrosia
notes: Potbelly's new mild. A drink of the Gods - the life extending properties of which are still under investigation.

name: Beijing Black
notes: Black beer. With dark malts, chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Lovely deep flavours. Sweetness on finish with hints of liquorice.

name: Crazy Daze
notes: A very light golden bitter with hidden strength - beware!

name: Pigs Do Fly
notes: A light and golden ale, this is a single hopped brew using Styrian Goldings.

name: Cwrw Glaslyn
notes: A golden coloured fruity best bitter with a well balanced hoppy finish.

name: Cwrw Madog
notes: A crisp, malty, reddish coloured session bitter with a dry bitter finish.

name: Royal Stag
notes: An amber coloured beer brewed from a blend of three malts to give a fruity, full bodied flavour with a dry finish to the palate. The blend of English hops creates a balanced, fruity character with a delicate spicy aroma. A beer in the style of a tradition English bitter.

name: Wills Neck
notes: Wills Neck, the highest point on the Quantock Hills overlooking the Bristol Channel, gives this beer its name. This bright golden ale has a rich malty flavour and is late hopped to produce a prominent aroma with hints of grapefruit and cherries and a lasting bitterness on the palate.

name: Firebox
notes: A reddish deep brown coloured beer which is a deceptively drinkable strong bitter with a fine combination of citrus hops and cherry fruit bittersweet flavours which gives a strong dry bitter finish.

name: Steam Pole
notes: with 3 varieties of English hops

name: English IPA
notes: A golden coloured Traditional English IPA brewed using the finest pale malt and Goldings hops. Smooth mouth feel showing fresh hoppy aromas and a fuller flavour.

name: London Porter
notes: A gold medal winning London Porter made with 2 pale malts and 3 coloured malts, dark brown/black colour, showing a balance of chocolate and roasted barley, full bodied on the palate with bittersweet liquorice and rich chocolate flavours supported by a lovely creaminess on the finish.

name: Red Tail
notes: A pale, crisp, low-gravity beer produced from the best Cascade and Liberty hops, balanced with floral and citrus notes, making this straw coloured ale appeal to both die-hard ale drinker and potential lager convert.

name: Hopspur
notes: Dark amber, packed full of hops in the aroma. Grapefruit hops continue in the body. Fruity, clean and refreshing.

name: Trinity
notes: Pale coloured with American hops

name: Fruits of the Forest
notes: A multi-layered beer in which summer fruits and several spices compete with a big hop presence.

name: Grateful Red
notes: This beer features Simcoe hops from Yakima U.S.A. It's fruity with hints of passion fruit and a lime/orange finish.

name: Junction
notes: Brewed with Challenger, Bramling Cross and Goldings hops, the beer has a deep amber colour with a spicy hop character.

name: Wandle
notes: Golden amber in colour. The beer is nicely balanced with an initial sweetness and hints of vanilla, offset by a refreshing dry hoppy finish.

name: Shalford 1319 Mild
notes: Roast malt and delicate chocolate sweetness with a slight bitter finish.

name: Springfield
notes: A refreshing, crisp, clean bitter made from a careful blend of wheat and barley malt with plenty of fizz, ideal for an afternoon in the beer garden.

name: Bus Pass Bitter
notes: An old fashioned bitter for those with a more mature taste, worth travelling for.

name: Golden Shower
notes: Full bodied golden beer with a light hop character and a defined maltness.

name: Muck Cart Mild
notes: A smooth dark mild with a long liquorice finish. Roast and fruit aroma with chocolate and coffee taste, and lingering roast finish.

name: Raspberry Wheat
notes: Strong aroma of raspberries followed by a smooth balanced fruity taste; very drinkable.

name: XL Ale
notes: Brewed to celebrate CAMRA's 40th anniversary using Chequers berries (fruit from the wild service tree), honey and spelt wheat. A smooth dry beer, rich ruby in colour. Imparts unusual characteristics from the Chequers berries, deceptively strong.

name: Maid Marian Blonde
notes: A pale golden beer with a fruity orange aroma and a dry peppery finish. Maid Marian is brewed with Maris Otter Pale malt, Cluster hops, and Nottingham Ale yeast. Its refreshing flavour is from a combination of fresh oranges, coriander and exotic Grains of Paradise. These were a common ingredient in 18th century beers and used as a substitute for pepper which at the time was heavily taxed. First brewed in 2010 to commemorate the Robin Hood film.

name: Robin Hood Bitter
notes: A dark traditional bitter with a good head and plenty of hops. It is brewed with Maris Otter Pale ,Crystal, and Dark Crystal malts, Northdown hops and Nottingham Ale yeast. Brewed to commemorate the recent Robin Hood film and the hugely successful CAMRA Robin Hood Beer Festival held in October in the grounds of Nottingham Castle each year.

name: Black Prince
notes: One of St Austell's best kept secrets, Black Prince is a black mild ale and well worth investigating. Deep, dark and intriguing, Black Prince has a full-bodied fruity flavour, the perfect complement to a steak & kidney pudding or steak & ale pie.

name: Endeavour
notes: A malty beer with hints of citrus hops. Copper coloured with a robust full body that belies its modest ABV.

name: Elmstead Stout
notes: Smooth full-bodied stout with a great roast barley taste

name: Tendring 100
notes: Pale Ale brewed with a fusion of English and American hops

name: Jaipur
notes: A citrus-dominated India Pale Ale, its immediate impression is soft and smooth yet builds to a crescendo of massive hoppiness accentuated by honey. An enduring, bitter finish.

name: Lord Marples
notes: Surprisingly smooth with light toffee and caramel characters, a mixture of floral and spicy hop notes and a pleasing bitter finish.

name: Black Night
notes: A Cornish Mild available during the month of May only.

name: Harbour Special
notes: Prize winning beer with a dark amber hue and an initial malty flavour with a citrus after taste.

name: Lyme Gold
notes: Brewed using Maris Otter Pale Malt together with Cascade and Bobek hops. A pale summer ale. Easy drinking with a refreshing citrus aroma.

name: Town Mill Best
notes: reddish brown, nutty flavour

name: Bring Me Sunshine
notes: If your preferred tipple is hoppy, then this brew will suit. Golden-brown in colour, it is brewed with citrus hops in abundance.

name: Death or Glory
notes: A dark aromatic, estery strong ale brewed using the finest Maris Otter malt and premium aroma hops.

name: Mansion Mild
notes: A smooth, creamy, ruby dark mild with a fruity palate and gentle late hop aroma

name: Golden Kiwi
notes: A pale golden refreshing best bitter. Hopped exclusively with Motueka, Nelson Sauvin and N.Z. Cascade.

name: Piston Bob
notes: A premium amber bitter, more-ish with well balanced sweet toffee malt flavours and a crisp, spicy hop finish. Brewed using rare Belgian malts and Czech lager hops.

name: Stargazer
notes: Deep golden best bitter heavily hopped with American Simcoe and Summit hops.

name: Golden Drop
notes: A golden coloured, hoppy, refreshing ale brewed using Brewers Gold and Amarillo hop varieties.

name: Rupert's War Dog
notes: Chestnut brown with a good sweet bitter balance.

name: Stakes Ale
notes: The second brew available from Upham Brewery, Stakes Ale is a mid coloured stronger beer at 4.6%. For those that like a stronger fuller flavoured beer.

name: Upham Ale
notes: The first beer available from this Classic Hampshire Farmstead is Upham Ale. At 4% ABV Upham Ale is a very well constructed mid colour ale with a roasted malty nose, a hint of chocolate and a pronounced hoppy finish.

name: Vens Mild
notes: A smooth malty dark mild bursting with plenty of roasted flavours; a very satisfying finish.

name: Bean Dibbler
notes: An amber-coloured beer with a fruity, hop finish from English Cascade hops

name: Magg's Magnificent Mild
notes: A typical dark mild with a slightly higher hop rate than normally used in milds. Not too sweet and very popular.

name: Arbor Light
notes: Sharp and very clean with lots of hop character. Delicate light aroma. Very thirst quenching.

name: Flower Power
notes: Initial warmth followed by intense citrus flavours developing. Medium to full bodied, with complex hop character. Dry finish and very hoppy aroma. Deceptively strong.

name: Coopers WPA
notes: A yellow-gold, well balanced, light,refreshing brew with hops, citrus fruit & a delicate sweet maltiness, giving a bitter dry finish.

name: Rite Flanker
notes: Brewed just for the Six Nations Championships, this is an excellent brew full of muscle and determination. With a delicate blend of those oh so beautiful Fuggles & Challenger hops.

name: Conqueror
notes: A rich, complex and very distinctive black IPA, brewed with a careful blend of 5 speciality malts along with Summit and Cascade hops to produce an intense combination of roasted flavours balanced with full fresh pine hop aroma.

name: Knights of the Garter
notes: A straw-coloured Golden Ale for easy summer drinking with a distinctive fresh citrus hop aroma.

name: Golden
notes: A refreshing yellow golden ale with nicely balanced malt, hop and light tangy citrus flavours. Derived from a blend of American, Slovenian and English hops.

name: Revenge
notes: Amber coloured and well-hopped, for a distinct bitterness with a sweetish finish that makes this a warmer beer.

name: King's Royal Mild
notes: A tawny coloured classic mild, lightly hopped, lacking any obvious bitterness and extremely thirst quenching; a fruity, sweet perfume on the nose, a distinctive smooth body, full of character a crisp, lasting creamy head. There is a light dryness in the finish, lingering hint of toffee, warms the palate with light peppery overtones coming from a mix of Slovenian and English hops.

name: Red River
notes: The aroma has vine fruits with a hint of caramel toffee from the aromatic malt and a nod towards the hoppiness to come. A smooth, full mouthfeel with an initial taste of almonds and some metallic flavour from the hops, which grows into a long lingering bitter aftertaste with hints of pine and spice.

name: Lavender Honey
notes: Honey from The Norfolk Lavender Company is added during the brewing process to give this beer a delicate yet more-ish flavour.

name: Lupus Lupus
notes: Unique Flavoured blonde ale using fruity hops.

name: Straw Dog
notes: Pale and refreshing, this clear wheat beer is brewed in the German style. Soft German hops added to the brew give a wonderful aroma and slightly sweet taste.

name: Headcracker
notes: Pale but strong and full-bodied. Carries an intricate combination of plums and damsons countered by an abundance of 'citrus' hopping.

name: Nelson's Revenge
notes: Rich and floral aromas, sweet Norfolk malts and a burst of 'citrus' hops embody this mouth-watering premium beer.

name: Norfolk Nog
notes: Smooth, rich and rounded 'Old Ale' with velvety texture and hints of chocolate, treacle and liquorice.

name: Once Bittern
notes: A copper coloured ale with a distinctive aroma of rich spice and citrus fruit. The palate is a blend of sweet malt, fruit and warm spice, and the finish dry.

name: Sundew
notes: Subtle golden beer. Pale in colour and light on the palate with a distinct hoppy finish. Deliciously golden and refreshing.

name: Wherry
notes: Fresh and zesty with crisp floral flavours. A background of sweet malt and a hoppy 'grapefruit' bitter finish this champion bitter.

name: Centurion's Ghost
notes: Dark ruby in colour, full tasting with a mellow roast flavour balanced by light bitterness and autumn fruit flavours that linger into the aftertaste.

name: Guzzler
notes: A light golden beer with well balanced hops and malt against a background of fruitiness. Crisp, dry, and refreshing.
